title: Augusta County: John Quincy Adams Nadenbousch to Hester J. Nadenbousch, November 1, 1863
summary: Nadenbousch writes his wife and announces arrangements are going forward to open the hotel he has purchased. He regrets his wife will not be able to join him in Staunton, but suggests that perhaps Freddy should be sent as a cure for his "reckless" behavior. He also discusses supplies he would like sent.
keywords: Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
